title: Guide to Concurrency in Python with Asyncio
excerpt: This is a quick guide to Python’s asyncio module and is based on Python version 3.8. Introduction Why focus on asyncio? A quick asyncio summary A quick concurrent.futures summary Green Threads? Event Loop Awaitables Coroutines Tasks Futures Running an asyncio program Running Async Code in the REPL Use another Event Loop Concurrent Functions Deprecated Functions Examples gather wait wait_for as_completed create_task Callbacks Pools Executors asyncio.Future vs concurrent.futures.Future asyncio.wrap_future Introduction So let’s start by addressing the elephant in the room: there are many modules provided by the Python standard library for handling asynchronous/concurrent/multiprocess code…
